message: I think there are two events here: resource_modified and resource_wanted. resource_modified could happen at any time. resource_wanted happens when I'm ready to use the resource and want to know if I should download a new copy.

I need to do some processing when a web resource changes. I'm using http:head() to fetch the ETag for this resource, and storing it in an application variable. What are my options for firing rules based when this resource changes?
I can create two defactions: use_local_copy() and download(). These both send directives to my custom (node.js) endpoint.
I'd like to write "select when resource_modified before resource_wanted". Can that work or do I need to write "select when resource_wanted if resource_has_changed() then download()"
What if I put the ETag into an app variable and store the latest I've seen in an entity variable? That way the app variable can be updated anytime.
